item.title: Bitcoin Weekly 2016 May 25: U.S. Postal Service looks into blockchain-technology, Bitcoin smart contracts by end of 2016, SaruTobi Android app
item.description:
Bitcoin Weekly 2016 May 25: U.S. Postal Service looks into blockchain-technology, Bitcoin smart contracts by end of 2016, SaruTobi Android app

This week the Bitcoin community saw a fairly slow news cycle but there's still some gems to be found. The United States Postal Service released a report on Monday outlining the government's approach to using blockchain-technology to enhance what the post office already does, and add services such as financial services and identity management for citizens.

item.title: Xtrade - The Best Place to Begin Trading CFDs - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Xtrade - The Best Place to Begin Trading CFDs - NEWSBTC

Xtrade is a European brokerage house offering trading activity in financial derivatives. The company was founded in 2002, and has expanded to be established in more than 15 countries all over Europe, South America, and Asia. Xtrade provides its services in 15 EU countries - Poland, Germany, Spain, Portugal, France, Czech Republic, Italy, Romania, Slovakia, ...

item.title: Lost your shirt in the MtGox mess? Kraken may pay you back
item.description:
Lost your shirt in the MtGox mess? Kraken may pay you back

The operators of the Kraken exchange will distribute $91m in Bitcoins to people left out of pocket by the 2014 MtGox collapse. Kraken, appointed to oversee the remains of the MtGox estate, says it has reviewed and determined the status of all Bitcoin claims by MtGox's customers.

item.title: Are there any Blockchain-as-a-Service platform providing immutable data storage for people who do not want to build their own blockchains?
item.description:
Are there any Blockchain-as-a-Service platform providing immutable data storage for people who do not want to build their own blockchains?

Answer: Yes. Tierion allows you to create verifiable proofs of your data using the Bitcoin blockchain. You send Tierion either raw data, or pre-generated SHA-256 hashes of your data and receive a blockchain receipt in return. Your blockchain receipt is a digital proof that you can use to independ...

item.title: Goldman Sachs: Blockchain Tech Could Save Capital Markets $6 Billion a Year - CoinDesk
item.description:
Goldman Sachs: Blockchain Tech Could Save Capital Markets $6 Billion a Year - CoinDesk

A new report from Goldman Sachs Investment Research projects that the implementation of blockchain technology could streamline the clearing and settlement of cash securities, saving capital markets $2bn in the US and $6bn globally on an annual basis.

item.title: Deloitte Opens New Blockchain Research Lab in Ireland
item.description:
Deloitte Opens New Blockchain Research Lab in Ireland

Financial services giant Deloitte announced today the opening of their new blockchain center in Dublin, Ireland. The EMEA Financial Services Blockchain Lab will be staffed with 50 developers, which the company says will be recruited over the next 18 months.

item.title: Bitcoin Protocol Role Models * Gavin Andresen
item.description:
Bitcoin Protocol Role Models * Gavin Andresen

A couple of months ago, I was having Yet Another Argument with a Bitcoin Core contributor about the one megabyte block size limit. I had asked: "what other successful Internet protocols impose arbitrary limits on themselves similar to the... | Gavin Andresen | Bitcoin developer. All-around geek.

item.description: My 1st month on #OpenBazaar: 5 sales to 4 customers for ~.5 btc, Store is online 24/7, Over 50 listings, #zerofees, and one happy ME!

item.title: Bitcoin hardware wallet maker KeepKey acquires MultiBit
item.description:
Bitcoin hardware wallet maker KeepKey acquires MultiBit

"We have had a very close relationship with MultiBit since we announced our own product last year in July," said KeepKey founder and CEO Darin Stanchfield in email correspondence with CoinReport.

item.title: Why do leading ASICs manufacturers sell their chips?
item.description:
Why do leading ASICs manufacturers sell their chips?

Some companies have done exactly that, and have come under fire for it. Butterfly Labs was famously outed by US authorities for running customer-purchased hardware to generate profit for themselves, only releasing to the customer after the purchased-hardware was past its peak profit-generating potential.
